Hi,

I need to use the quota enforcer to limit the download to 200 host suc=
cessful fetches, but I noticed it's not working the way I expected it to.

=
I ran the job with one seed, configuring the quota enforcer like this:

<be=
an id=3D"quotaEnforcer" class=3D"org.archive.crawler.prefetch.QuotaEnforcer=
">
  <property name=3D"hostMaxFetchSuccesses" value=3D"200"/>
  <property n=
ame=3D"forceRetire" value=3D"true"/> 
</bean>


<bean id=3D"fetchProcessors=
" class=3D"org.archive.modules.FetchChain">
  <property name=3D"processors"=
>
   <list>
    <!-- recheck scope, if so enabled... -->
    <ref bean=3D"p=
reselector"/>
    <!-- apply quota -->
    <ref bean=3D"quotaEnforcer"/> 
.=
.......

 and at the end I got the following response code report:

[#urls]=
 [rescode]
85 404
84 200
29 301
1 1
1 302
1 502


After that I tried runnin=
g the same job, only I changed the quota enforcer to:

<bean id=3D"quotaEnf=
orcer" class=3D"org.archive.crawler.prefetch.QuotaEnforcer">
  <property na=
me=3D"hostMaxFetchResponses" value=3D"200"/>
  <property name=3D"forceRetir=
e" value=3D"true"/> 
</bean>

 and got this report:

[#urls] [rescode]
85 2=
00
85 404
29 301
1 1
1 302


 It seems that in the two cases it does the sa=
me thing, finishing the job when it hits 200 fetches, whatever the response=
 code is. 

 Is there something that I am missing, or doing wrong? 

 Thank=
s,
 Alexandra
